events.message: The insured called to file a claim after their car was involved in a collision on the highway, causing significant front-end damage.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the reported vehicle collision and damage details provided.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim and to coordinate next steps with the policyholder.
The insured received formal acknowledgment of their car accident claim via email, confirming receipt and outlining the process.
Request sent to the claimant asking for police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates to facilitate investigation.
Claimant submitted all requested documents including police report and detailed photographs of the damaged vehicle parts.
Investigation commenced to evaluate the extent of the vehicle damage and to verify circumstances of the car accident claim.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that collision details match submitted evidence and policy coverage applies.
A settlement offer was prepared based on damage assessment and coverage limits; claimant was notified of proposed payout.
The claimant provided positive feedback appreciating the transparency and speed of the claim processing so far.
Claim was formally approved by the claims manager following claimant's acceptance of the proposed settlement amount.
Payment for the approved settlement was processed and issued to the claimantâ€™s designated account promptly.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and resolution of all outstanding issues.
All claim documents and case files were archived securely per retention policies after closure completion.
